intro: Sarcanthopsis quaifei, commonly known as the New Zealand rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine regions. It has a low-growing habit with basal leaves and is well adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of its native habitat. Sarcanthopsis quaifei is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
